Projects

As a new brigade, one of the first things we're doing is thinking of projects that can positively impact the community.

We always want to hear about projects that you want to work on with us. We are an organization that will be driven by our community, and we're here to help connect people and build impactful projects. Please come to our meetings to work on existing projects or to bring your own!

We will follow Code for America's proven model for building services, which you can read about at CodeForAmerica.org

.

Planned Projects

Renters' Rights

Potential Partners
Kentucky Equal Justice Center
Metropolitan Housing Coalition
Potential Seed Project
Code for San Jose's renters-rights app

In our conversations with lawyers and those working in the housing space, we have heard that there is a need for a tool that will help increase renters' knowledge of their right as well as generate documentation and correspondence to their landlords. We would like to work with Kentucky Equal Justice Center and Metropolitan Housing Coalition to build a tool that they could help get in the hands of renters.

Skills Needed
  • Product Management
  • Project Management
  • Law
  • Public Policy
  • Design
  • Copywriting
  • Web Development

Teacher Exchange

Potential Partners
KY 120 United

We have had conversations with teachers about the need for a website to allow educators to swap materials, lesson plans, and other resources.

Skills Needed
  • Product Management
  • Project Management
  • Design
  • Copywriting
  • Web Development
